name: Napa River Inn at the Historic Napa Mill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent two nights at this inn. Our room was clean, very comfortable and nicely furnished. Rates included an fine breakfast as well. The inn is close to downtown and several excellent restaurants. We enjoyed the food and jazz at Uva's and a fine italian dinner at Ristorante Allegria. Needless to say, the Napa area is beautiful and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Very nice Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although the surrounding area looked like a construction zone, the location was perfect. There was a short drive to the outlets, Hwy 29 and the Silverado Trail. At night we could walk to dinner. The room was sunny and had a balcony over looking the river. The in-room breakfast from Sweetie Pies bakery was excellent. I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

likes.liked: — The in-room breakfast from Sweetie Pies
likes.disliked: — The rooms are in separate buldings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed at Napa River Inn one evening, but found the experience wonderful. The staff was helpful, particularly Armando and Tiffany. They recommended perfect spots for our tours of Napa Valley and dinner spots. We had a delicious breakfast, and our room overlooked the river on the 2nd floor of the Embarcadero section. The room was small but comfortable, with high quality bedding and mattress. We hated leaving, and can't wait to return.
reviews.title: Perfect place offering great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: Nice hotel BUT only a few rooms are worth the price.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Only a Few Rooms are worth the price

likes.liked: — The rooms in one building were gorgeous
likes.disliked: — No true view, noise (hotels own noise), overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The Plaza building rooms look like any Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn - Will be perfect when complete

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I was a little wary of booking here because I heard about the construction. While I could see it from the balcony, I wasn't disturbed by noise or anything because I think they must limit it to working hours on weekdays. I chose this hotel because it was within walking distance to some great restaurant choices. Zuzu serves tapas right up the street and was the best meal of my entire trip; I dream about the heirloom tomato tarte tatin. I also had a great day with the Napa Winery Wine Shuttle; it's affordable and I was impressed with the variety of wineries we went to and and the friendliness and knowledge of our guide. On another day, the concierge booked a car service for me to visit some wineries and I also thoroughly enjoyed that as well. Lastly, I had read about the amazing breakfast in bed from Sweetie Pie's and I was underwhelmed, primarily because the choices were limited and I did not like the egg sandwich at all. However, I asked at the front desk if I could bring my ticket to the bakery and they substituted things of equal value, which I liked a lot better. The almond croissants are delicious!
reviews.title: Convenient location in Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying, this is a beautiful historic property. The rooms were magnificent- very elegant and very comfortable. The staff was extremely helpful. Rhianna, ,the concierge, was very helpful in her suggestions and in booking our reservations. Breakfast at Sweetie Pie, the bakery next door, was delicious, as were their snacks and desserts. We did not get to eat at Celadon, the restaurant in the hotel, although I know they did get rave reviews. We did eat at the restaurant a few doors down, Angele, and the meal was superb.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel- less than desireable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With all that said, the location at this point in time was disappointing. We had a room with a balcony, but it overlooked construction right under our room, and the view across the river was that of an industrial strip. So there was no reason to go out on the balcony, and in fact we kept the blinds closed. They are constructing a riverwalk, which will make the property lovely when it is completed, but right now the construction around the hotel makes it less than relaxing, and an eyesore. We woke up on our second morning, which was Monday, to the sound of construction equipment right under our window at 7:30 in the morning.
reviews.title: Great!! But Construction...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once the riverwalk is finished, I think this will be a lovely hotel to stay in.
reviews.title: Napa River Inn is THE Place!

likes.liked: — The staff - the people here are just fantastic.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: great hotel. we booked a standard room. they do not let you choose the type of bed (2 queens, or king) on their website -- bummer. but all i had to do was call in and requested a king for my girlfriend and i. the room was fantastic. great view of the river. clean bathroom. it's right there near main street. you can walk to a ton of great restaurants. there is a bakery that provides complimentary breakfast delivered to your room at a specified time. my advice, be very specific on the card they give you at check-in.
reviews.title: Great place, great location...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely restored hotel, but, don't plan on sleeping here.
reviews.title: Sleepless in Napa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This is our first night and we were awakened at 3:00 AM to the sounds of an 18 wheeler unloading a delivery for a restaurant on the property. My spouse successfully has gone back to sleep because we turned on the air conditioner for some white noise, but, I'm freezing and sitting here writing this review.
reviews.title: in the middle of a construction zone- what river???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room is a deluxe room and overlooks the Napa River and a construction zone. ($320/night) There are no drawers for clothing except for the two small drawers in each night stand. It does have a fireplace and small cramped sitting area, as well as a separate bath & shower. However, there's only a very small sink area. We'll probably kill one another if we try to get dressed at the same time.
reviews.title: Beware the Captain Hatt Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Last night we ate at the restaurant receiving the delivery (Angele) and it was excellent.
reviews.title: Restored the senses!

likes.liked: — Good restaurant right on the door step of a good comfortable accomodation! Perfect!
likes.disliked: — No toilet on the ground floor in the reception area! But I was desperate!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: If you stay here, insist on a room as far away from the main hotel as possible. Now, I know why ear plugs are provided.
reviews.title: Great girls trip
What a nice place!
reviews.text: We booked this place because it was affordable & in Napa. What a surprise! We didn't get to the property until late day so the construction didn't bother us. We love small, old hotels so this was perfect. The fact that it was new & beautifully decorated was a nice surprise. The fact that there were 2 great restaurants (we did Angele which was fantastic!) within steps of our door, plus an art gallery & general store made us wish we were staying longer than 1 night. The complimentary breakfast delivered from Sweetie Pies within the complex was a lovely finish to our visit. This is a great place!

reviews.title: Hisroric Pleasure
reviews.text: We traveled with friends for an overnight stay after visiting wine country in Napa. The hotel's transformation from an old mill to a gem of a hotel is impressive and unique. Being an interior designer, I had great appreciation for the decor and the well thought out ammenities. From the minute you walk through the lobby door to your room destination, ambiance with a traditional theme envelopes you. The front desk staff was helpful and the breakfast delivered to your room the next morning is more than adequate and delicious. Yes, the dry river bed and the construction zone certainly doesn't add to the character of the hotel, but the vision for a future stay is further enhansed with the improvements for all future quests to enjoy. We read the reviews before making our hotel selection and new what to expect. If we hadn't known this in advance, we would have been disappointed. That said, take a chance on this hotel and close your eyes to the hotels surrounds for the short term, and enjoy what the hotel itself has to offer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel was nice. Staff was very accomodating. The delivery of breakfast to your room each day was a nice added touch. The only drawback was the hotel did not mention that they are totally under construction due to some flooding from the Napa River. We were told the construction has been ongoing for quite sometime. We were disappointed because we wanted a view room, which we got, but a view of scaffolding. We understand construction, but they should have mentioned it at booking and also, we feel the rates should be lowered. $229.00 a night for a construction zone is a bit high in our opinion.
reviews.title: Nice Property!

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the rooms, Breakfast Room Delivery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The nightly wine and cheese party was nice. We loved the robes in our rooms too!! klbabich@yahoo.com
reviews.title: I Love Historic Hotels

likes.liked: — The whole 'modern hotel amenities' in a beautifully thought out historic hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: This hotel is truly wonderful, it brings together the elements of a great historic landmark, with well thought out modern conveniences and super efficient service. Our room was beautiful and clean, with every detail of our comfort considered. And we just loved the staff. It was like having our own personal team taking care of us.
reviews.title: This is a wonderful historic hotel with lots of charm to love.
Don't miss it!!!
reviews.text: We stayed for one night in Feb and would easily recommend this hotel to anyone.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pros: check-in was fast and friendly, we had a romance package that included chocolate-covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne (very nice!), the room was large and comfortable, everything was very clean, the breakfast included was AMAZING, great location - easy to walk to everything in Napa, parking is free
reviews.title: Great Attention to Details!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cons: Balcony was super tiny and not really usable, the floors creak when you walk on them, bed is pretty comfortable, but not overly so like a Marriott or Hilton bed
reviews.title: Nice place, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For $189, you can't beat a great location, included breakfast, champagne, and strawberries and a clean room in the middle of downtown Napa.
reviews.title: noisy aircon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying at this Inn you can tell that they put a lot of thought into every last detail. Check in was quick and efficient and the staff was very courteous. Our room fit the style of the Old Hatt Building and was very welcoming with the colors and patterns. We had a balcony and a fireplace in the room. There was also a bottle of wine and chocolates waiting for us with a note from the manager when we arrived. We took our 3 year old son with us, and he had a fabulous time! He loved the turndown service and the chocolates that they left on his pillow. Sweetie Pies had a very tasty breakfast that we all enjoyed. Would definitely stay there again and recommend the place to anyone.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay at the Inn

likes.liked: — Pretty room, good bed,nice bathroom, fireplace
likes.disliked: — No view of river, one small window.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: You should know that the Napa River is brown, with not a speck of blue or green, and there is construction going on (for flood control we were told) so don't get your hopes up. A vineyard view at another hotel would have been preferrable to the "river view" we booked. The room was exactly like the pictures others posted however the room smelled just like air freshener from a gas station restroom. Unfortunately it was 90 degrees the 2 days we were there so couldn't open the window. The downtown location is good but hotel parking is limited due to the small lot so if the valet is busy its a long time to get in and out. The rate included a muffin, juice and coffee to the room for breakfast but our rate there was still too high as compared to the Marriott for example. Its tourist season and the inn was full so I guess they can overcharge for what you get and still get the customers.
reviews.title: no view and musty smell

likes.disliked: — smelled musty from the wall air conditioner

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has downtown location but other than that the room just didn't feel updated and clean enough. I'm anxious to see what other travellers thought so I'll be following this site.
reviews.title: Best Customer Serive & Bed

likes.disliked: — No free wine in the room...lol....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First impression was...oh no look & listen to all the construction noise right next to our hotel. My husband and I were there for a special occasion and to get some peace and quite so we were somewhat sceptical at our first impression...but don't let this comment detour you from going!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When checking in we were greated with warm smiles and a hello. We were told that we would not be able to get our room for 45 minutes...no problem ,we thought we'd go roam the little town and sample some wines.....but at the last moment the manager (I presume...or the person in charge at the time) looked at our reservation...noticed that we were there for a special occasion, and that I had requested to be placed in their quietest room. To our joy and surprise he said that we did not need to wait for our room, that he was upgrading us to one of their historic suites for free.
reviews.title: Perfect Experience!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now that's what I call customer service and truley paying attention to what customers request when making their reservations and going above and beyond.
reviews.title: We Loved It!!!!
Charming Little Place
reviews.text: I usually don't like to stay at historic hotels, but this seemed to be the best deal I could find. What a great little find--the hotel is located in a historic mill just a few blocks off downtown Napa. We stayed in the Plaza building, and the only donwside to it was our room overlooked the courtyard of the Celadon restaurant. On a more positive note, the room was nicely updated and the beds were very comfortable. Yummy Napa Valley Spa bath products, too. The front desk staff is extremely accommodating and will allow a late check out. All you have to do is ask nicely. I would stay there again.

reviews.title: Sweet Spot in Napa Town
reviews.text: We stayed one night (wish it could have been much longer) at the very end of Feb. I had an American Express offer of an upgrade and we rec'd Rm. #231 on the 2nd floor of the River Plaza Bldg. It had been updated recently and was in perfect condition; spacious and done in earth colors with deep terracotta-colored wallpaper, traditional European-style furnishings (very nice, but not luxurious), extremely comfortable King bed, 2 large armchairs, "fainting couch", writing desk and chair, and widescreen flat panel TV above the gas fireplace (a very nice treat on a chilly day). The bathroom was also quite spacious and had a marble counter, marble walls and tub surround, a towel warmer, extra large showerhead, bath robes, a small refrig. and even a small safe. There was a nice selection of teas plus pretty standard coffee. The only complaint we had with the room was that there was no place for 2 people to sit to eat our ample breakfast. I know the Inn says it's "breakfast in bed" but it would have been nice to have a small table. During warmer weather we could have eaten out on our small balcony which looked directly out to the Napa River and had a bistro table and 2 chairs. From our balcony we could watch the Wine Train heading to and from the depot; saw ducks, geese, seagulls and an egret in the river, and were treated to gorgeous fluffy clouds overhead and a nearly full moon that night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Construction work is ongoing along the river and along Main St. and so the area between the Inn and the River was not nearly as scenic as it will be when construction of the flood protection wall and the paved riverwalkway with landscaping is completed (prob. sometime in 2009--it's a huge project). There is also temporary green fencing up along the construction area and it's not a pretty sight. For those visitors who wish to sleep in, our riverfront room would not have been a good choice as the heavy equipment with "beep, beep, beep" warning signals began a bit before 7:30 a.m. (we stayed on a Wed. night). For my husband and me, it wasn't a problem since we were up by then. It was actually pretty interesting to view the work in progress and we saw some parents with their kids who came down to watch the earthmovers in action.
reviews.title: Romantic Honeymoon Hotel

likes.liked: — Breakfast in Bed, Location, Spa next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to our complimentary breakfast (from the on-premises bakery, Sweetie Pie): one is able to choose from a number of different items and categories. I had a bagel stuffed with fluffy egg and cheese, a wholegrain scone and fresh fruit. My husband had a croissant stuffed with egg and bacon, a Danish pastry and fresh orange juice. The portions were very large and both of us had something leftover. Along with choosing what to have, we were able to designate the time that we wanted the breakfast tray delivered to our room--and it arrived exactly on time.
reviews.title: Great Time, Great Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk person and the person who delivered our breakfast tray and also worked in the lobby were friendly and very pleasant. We loved the entire historic Old Mill complex containing the 3 bldgs of the Napa River Inn, the restaurants Celadon, Angele and Napa General Store (we had meals and or wine at all 3 and were extremely pleased), excellent art gallery and a pretty lavendar products shop. It's a visually delightful place (the artistic mosaic fountain in the River Plaza is particularly fun). It was great to be able to leave our car in the lot (free parking, I might add) and take a nice, easy walk up Main St. to any number of great restaurants, wine bars and lounges. You'l see some interesting historic bldgs as you walk north. The acclaimed n.v. restaurant where we had dinner is only about 4-1/2 blocks from the Napa River Inn. We also passed Zuzu and Cole's Chop House. And yes, we found n.v. to be the perfect dining experience: ambience, service and superlative cuisine. I can't recommend a restaurant more highly.
reviews.title: Atrocious Customer Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a two night stay at the Napa River Inn (and we stayed at a different hotel for two nights - we planned it that way!)
reviews.title: Pros and Cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: We liked the location - walking distance to many downtown restaurants and beautiful neighborhood where we went running both mornings. The bed is very comfortable. Sweetie Pies breakfast is delicious and Celadon restaurant is a must!
reviews.title: We had a wonderful stay

likes.liked: — It is a unique, historic property.

reviews.title: Ask more questions
reviews.text: CONS: We felt it was a little overpriced for the room and service. After being very dissatisfied with our room, we were upgraded at no charge. The room was a little larger (not much) and had a fireplace, balcony and river view. Still, not that impressive considering the price and that it was an upgraded room! Not to mention, there was construction all along the river and it was not in good shape! Also, very thin walls made it a little noisy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would probably stay here again because of the location and convenience, but the room was just average.
reviews.title: A wonderful experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Napa River Inn this past weekend, and it was absolutely wonderful. We had a Deluxe Room in the Historic Hatt Building. The room was magnificent. Very spacious, and decorated in heirloom-style furnishings. The canopy bed was huge, with a very comfortable mattress. There was also a nice sitting area with two comfortable chairs and a giant ottoman in front of a beautiful fireplace with the television mounted above. We really enjoyed sitting and relaxing after spending our days out exploring the spectacular Napa Valley. And the bathroom was awesome, with a slipper tub on one end and a two-person shower at the other end. This place was truly perfect for our relaxing romantic getaway.
reviews.title: THE NAPA RIVER INN IS A WONDERFUL HOTEL - LARGE ROOMS, BATH, AND WONDERFUL BEDDI

aka: Napa River Inn At The Historic Napa Mill Hotel
description: The Napa River Inn at the Historic Napa Mill is the perfect central location in Downtown Napa!Just one hour north of San Francisco, experience Napa Valley charm, luxury, and convenience at this romantic Napa Valley historic hotel, nestled in the heart of Napa Valley wine country.Established in 1884 by Captain Albert Hatt, the Historic Napa Mill, a registered Historic Landmark, boasts live entertainment, fine dining, wine tasting, spa, and shops. Whether you're traveling for business or pleasure, this downtown Napa historic inn will surprise and delight. Explore all of the attractions near the Napa River Inn, including: restaurants, wine tasting, shops, galleries, and the Wine Train.
